intro: Limonium tenoreanum, commonly known as the mountain sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family, which includes other coastal and arid-adapted plants. Limonium tenoreanum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and drought tolerance.
